    • Method Detail

      • compareJsonObjectValues

        public static int compareJsonObjectValues(Object left,
                                          Object right)
        In the context of two JsonValue.getObject() values, this will compare those two values. If the values are NOT a simple type of String, Number, or Boolean, the classname of the two objects is used as a fall-back sort order.
        Parameters:
        left - json object value to compare to the right.
        right - json object value to compare to the left.
        Returns:
        less than 0 if left is 'greater' than the right, greater than 0 if right is 'greater' than the left, 0 if equal.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if left or right are null.

      • getComparator

        public static Comparator<org.forgerock.json.JsonValue> getComparator(List<org.forgerock.json.resource.SortKey> sortKeys)
        This returns a comparator that iterates through the provided sortKeys and finds the first comparative difference between the left and right side JsonValues. To ensure consistency with sort order, at least one sortKey should be provided that will guarantee uniqueness between two JsonValues. A JsonValue that wraps a null object is considered less than one that is not. If both are wrapping a null, they are considered equal.
        Parameters:
        sortKeys - the sortKeys to utilize for sorting.
        Returns:
        a Comparator of JsonValues.
        See Also:
        compareJsonObjectValues(Object, Object)
